Quintessential FPS. Everyone should play this game, as well as Half Life 1 source (or the black mesa project) and the episodes. They are all excellent. Would recommend. 2 thumbs up.

For more than 10 years, HL2 has yet to be surpassed by any other game. And now with DK2 support...this is too much, I can't handle the awesomeness :) After playing it more than 15 times since 2004 including episodes, it feels like I'm experiencing this for the first time, only this time it's real, all around you... I LOVE IT !

Just imagine driving the hovercraft in Water Hazard and aiming at gunships by looking at them or being jumped by those fast f@ckers in Ravenholm with headcrabs on their heads, blowing them away in mid air with father Grigori's shotgun while they jump off buildings with the intention of r@ping your face :)

For real now, if you are a HL2 fan or not, this is something that every DK2 owner should try. This is the Holy Grail of gaming, for me at least. The only minor drawbacks are:
1. A longer adjusting period to overcome the motion sickness because it implies moving with your body in first person, but once you achieve that, it is a guaranteed mind-blowing experience.
​2. Zoomed view in the buggy/car on Highway 17 which is a bit annoying at first.
​3. Aiming can be frustating for some, but there are multiple modes that can be tried and you can easily adjust to the default scheme.

But I guess these issues are going to be solved in time. HL2 is definitely the benchmark for future VR games.
10/10 would rate 20/10 if there was hl3 confirmed by valve but this is. THE. BEST. F**KING. GAME. EVER.

This game came out over TEN years ago,  in November 2004.

It is still unrivialed as my favorite francise, It set the bar in 2004 and I find myself going through it again and again. Everyone on steam should own it. Play it. Love it. For its current going price of $5 bucks, you've got a crazy awesome game for almost nothing.

Don't think, just do it.

Just amazing. This has to be one of the greatest games of 2004 and maybe even one of the best of the decade and that's why I would give this a 10/10. The level designs are certainly nowhere near linear, and the combat feels just swell. The characters and the voice acting can't seem to make me yawn or flinch a bit and I can't seem to stop playing every little second of the way. The only issue I have with this game are the friendly AI helpers. They just seem to get in the way and it might get you killed and it will bother anyone. Another extremely minor issue that won't bother anyone is that I think that Canals carrys on for too damn long. Still a great game and I always tell dog when whenever to wake up "Rise and Shine, mister Freeman!". Now that is some major awesomeness you got right there.

"Hey, Gordon! The Citadel's on full alert, I've never seen it lit up like that! Get out of City 17 as fast as you can, Gordon; take the old canals, right? They'll get you to Eli's lab. It- It's a dangerous route, but there's a whole network of refugees, and they'll help you if they can. I'd come with you but I gotta look after Dr. Kleiner. Oh, and before I forget, I think you droped this back in Black Mesa. *drops crowbar* Good Luck out there buddy; you're gonna need it." And thus starts the best FPS story based game of all time.

10/10

A second game in a line of excellence.  Expanding on the everything that was good in the first game. This title lives up to its name. A fantastic play that is so rare in the FPS genre. If you don't own a copy of this game and you enjoy solving puzzles while blasting zombies and being awesome you owe it to yourself to give a few hours. There are few games that match the beauty, interest, and enjoyment that the half life series has to offer. 

9.1/10. Wake up Mr. Freeman. Wake up and smell the ashes.

This one of my all time favorite video games, and I'm not even finnished with the series. I'm just a few chapters in episode one, and I can't wait. I will say, this game can get boring at times. But when your just a few chapters away from finnishing, you could play for as long as it takes. (I did once play for 6 hours straight.) When your new you'll probably be looking on youtube to find out what to do or where to go, but later on you'll get the hang of it. The puzzle eventually just solves it self. I highly recomend this game to anyone. The graphics aren't half bad, and the gameplay is amazing.

Hola, quiziera reportar un error de el juego Half-life 2, en todas las entregas que tengo, es decir, Half-life 2, Half-life 2 Ep:One y Half-life Ep:Two, el error consiste en que cada vez que quiero iniciar el juego me aparece un error que dice asi:
Failed to load launcher DLL.
MI PC tiene sistema operativo Windows 7 de 64 bits.
Si conocen alguna solucion por favor de decirmela, Gracias...
Hello, I would like to report a bug in the game Half-Life 2, all deliveries that I have, ie, Half-Life 2, Half-Life 2 Ep: One and Half-Life Ep: Two, the error is that each time I want to start the game an error saying so I get:
Failed to load DLL launcher.
My PC has Windows 7 64-bit operating system.
If you know any solution please tell it to me, Thanks...
